page.title: 05LAND USE - HAUGHTON,SPURSTOW
page.content:
______________________________
Most of the area is grassland and with the introduction of milk quotas (1984) dairy farmers became more aware of the need for economic use of grass for summer grazing and winter silage. The majority of cows are Friesians (black & white), but some Jersey cows are bred by specialist breeders. Cows are milked in parlours. The milk is stored in cooled bulk tanks and taken daily to dairies (out of the area) where it is pasteurised for human consumption, or made into butter or cheese. The surplus is dried and either sold or stored as part of the EEC surplus. Land prices before the milk quotas rose to Â£3000 per acre but have now fallen to Â£2000 - Â£1500. Dairy cows are about Â£500 each with top quality making considerably more.
